document.docAuthor: Carpenter, James M. & Brown, Graham R.
document.masterDocTitle: Catalogue of the Australian Eumeninae (Hymenoptera: Vespidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Catalogue of the Australian Eumeninae (Hymenoptera: Vespidae)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Vespa campaniformis Fabricius 1775: 371
, sex not stated—“Nova Hollandia ” ( holotype female London); 1781: 467; 1787: 292.—
Gmelin 1790: 2753
.—Olivier 1792 [1791]: 670.—
Fabricius 1793: 277
.

Sphex campaniformis
;
Christ 1791: 312
(translation of original description).

Eumenes campaniformis
;
Fabricius 1804: 287
.—de Saussure 1852: 55 ( Australia ); 1855: 131 (? variety of
E . esuriens
).—
Meade-Waldo 1914: 404
( type examined; syns.:
E . urvillei de Saussure
and
E . tricolor Cameron
).—
Bequaert 1926b: 541
, fig.11 (“typical colour phase”: Java; Philippines ; Yule I.; Qld.); 1928a: 61 ( type is female).—
Hoffmann 1938: 455
( China : Kwangtung).—
Maehler 1947: 27
(Oahu).—
Swezey 1950: 15
(Oahu).—
Thomsen 1951: 209
(Molokai).—
Maehler 1956: 5
(Hawaii).—
Beardsley 1957: 190
(prey: caterpillars of
Heliothis virescens
(F.)).—
Anderson et al. 1982: 543
, 545 (pollinator of mango).

Eumenes esuriens
;
Smith 1861a: 86
(New Guinea : Triton Bay); 1861b: 126 (Batjan); 1871: 371 (cat.) [ partim ].—
Froggatt 1892: 227
(cat.).—
Bingham 1897: 335
(key), 342 [ partim ].—de
Saussure 1904: 195
( Cambodia , Vietnam ).—

(Java).—
Koningsberger 1912: 167
(Java).—
Hoffmann 1938: 455
( China : Kwangtung).—von
Schulthess 1935: 299
(Java; Timor; N. T.: Burnside, Darwin). Misidentification.

Eumenes esuriens var. campaniformis
;
Maindron 1882: 270–272
(notes).—
Dalla Torre 1894: 23
(cat.); 1904: 22 (cat.).—
Zavattari 1911: 3
( Java ).—du Buysson 1913 [1911]: 230 (Kei).

Eumenes tricolor Cameron 1906a: 64
, female—“Humboldt Bay, New Guinea ” (Amsterdam). [junior primry homonym of

].—
Meade-Waldo 1914: 404
(synonym of

(F.)).

Eumenes edwardsii
; von
Schulthess 1914: 263
( Sumatra ). Misidentification.

Eumenes campaniformis var. gracilis
;
Bequaert 1926b: 541
(key), 544 (specimens from Lower Siam ; Taiwan).—
Giordani Soika 1941: 229
(key; in subgenus
Delta
).

Eumenes gracilis var. esuriens
;
Dover 1926: 233
( China : Hong Kong ). Misidentification.

Eumenes caffer var. esuriens
;
Dover 1929: 44
( Singapore ), 73 (immature stages). Misidentification.

Eumenes campaniformis var. campaniformis
;
Giordani Soika 1934a: 227
.

Delta campaniforme gracilior Giordani Soika 1986c: 88
, female, male—“ Luzon: Matnog, Sorsogon” ( holotype female coll. Kojima); also from Palawan; 1987: 147 (Borneo, Bali).—
Gusenleitner 1991: 262
(Sulawesi).—
Giordani Soika 1992: 63
;
1993a: 29
(Sulawesi). — Borsato 1994: 169 (Qld.: Cairns; N. T.: Darwin; N. S. W.: Urunga; W. A.: “Kimberley, 1.5 km . W. Mt. Bell, (17°.10’S. e 125°.17’E.),” “ 1 km . NE Mt. Bell,” “6,5– 8 km . NNE Mt. Broome”); 1996: 224 (Qld.: Brisbane, “Hervey Range, Speed Creek” [Harvey], “Harvey Range, Keelbottom Creek,” “Harvey Range, Fryersroad,” Port Douglas, Townsville, Townsville Heatley, Wacol).—
Gusenleitner 2006: 694
( India ).—

subSubSection.paragraph:
Delta campaniforme campaniforme
; Giordani Soika 1987: 147 .— Gusenleitner 1987: 269 ( Nepal ); 1988, Linz. Biol. Beitr. 20: 184 ( Thailand ).— Giordani Soika & Kojima 1988: 182 ( Papua New Guinea ).— Giordani Soika 1991: 166 (Sumatra); 1992: 63.—Borsato 1994 [1993]: 250 (
campaniformis
; Qld.: Cairns).— Jamieson, 1999: 24 (Kauai).— Borsato 2003: 562 (N. T.: “Darwin, Botanic Garden”; Qld.: “Mareeba, Granite Gorge,” Ingham; W. A.: “Kimberley, 1 km NE of Mt Bell; ( 17.10S 125.17E )”, “Kimberley, 6,5 km NNE of Mt Broome ( 17.21S— 125.23E )”).— Carpenter 2008: 6 (Hawaiian records).— Brown 2009: 29 (N. T.: North Coast).—
Nugroho et al. 2012
[2011]: 86 (list).—
Nugroho et al. 2013
, 9, figs. 18, 20, 22, 24, 26, 28, 30 (key; syn.:
D. campaniforme gracilior Giordani Soika
).—

(list).— Nguyen 2015: 97 (key), figs. 1G, 2B, 3D ( Vietnam ).—

, 168 (key), figs. 1–3 ( China ).
